intro: Anemone amagisanensis, commonly known as the Amagisan anemone, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately divided, and its stems are usually hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
